title: SSH tunneling option is not shown in v1.76.20
author: albertonietoxeridia
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
In 1.76.20 the option ssh tunnel is not present in ssh connections
## Expected Behavior
<!--- If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen -->
<!--- If you're suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work -->
A connection with the option ssh tunnel

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet:
I do not get what the issue here is. 

- If it's a feature request, please state it like this. 
- If it's a version dependent thing, please try one of the newer (nighly) releases. 

In case putty offers you the desired option, you might take the workaround of setting up a saved connection with the tunneling option configured.

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: Hello, this version is not planed to receive any fixes, please try new NB

comments.author: albertonietoxeridia
comments.snippet: Ok, thanks. I check in the nighly release the tunneling option is allow

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet:
Triage refresh (P4 version-label debt): this issue is tagged with legacy version labels. Please retest on the latest build (fork v1.79.x or upstream dev), then share reproducible steps and expected vs actual behavior. If still valid, keep open and relabel to current triage scope (for example Need 2 check). If fixed, close with resolution.

Current legacy version labels: 1.76.20
